title: Now I understand why Ekko is played as a tank/bruiser
body:
As full AP if you aren't ahead you either 
1.) Have to ult before you can even get your passive off
2.) Die so fast you can't even ult

tl;dr - THERE IS TOO MUCH DAMAGE IN LEAGUE PLEASE LOWER IT

His ult is 150% AP ratio. ok. When do you ever hit ult on a non-braindead enemy? Once every 10 games?
His passive is 80% and requires 3 hits. One from phase dive and one from opening of Q.
80%+20%+40% is 140% ap. Very rarely do you hit the 2nd part of Q because you have to ult back or run away before you die.
If you do hit the second part, it's 200% ap. That's pretty decent, yes, but it's realistically 140%.
You can't just exclude part of his kit. Regardless he got nerfs to his bases and buffs to his ratios several times by this point.

I really want them to just rework Ekko into a healthy tank/skirmisher. Since he is pretty much only viable as a tank, why cant they just turn him into an actual tank/skirmisher but make his kit healthy for that.

EDIT:
I meant but forgot to include this. They should rework him to make his tank build healthy, or they should just do whatever they can to bury tank ekko into the ground and make him more useless and a b5 playing the current azir. Only then will AP ekko be the only thing people build.

They just really want to preserve him as an AP skirmisher. A large part of what makes Tank Ekko unhealthy is his ridiculous mobility from his E allowing him to stick to targets and really abuse his base damages, but that's not something you could really take away. It'd be like removing Akali's ult to eliminate her tank builds. Ekko is pretty much inherently an unhealthy tank, but he's pretty okay as a skirmisher, and attempting to make him an okay tank would absolutely gut him in terms of his identity. If they really wanted to try to make a healthy version of Tank Ekko, they'd definitely have to do it by making a new champion and not by reworking Ekko.

I'm in the other camp: His AP Assassin playstyle is far more rewarding, far more (in my opinion) fun, and *definitely* a healthier game-play pattern. It's very possibly my favorite champion playstyle in the game, despite playing this game since like beta.

I've been hoping they'd gut "Tank Ekko" builds since his release. Assassin Ekko is a balanced, decent-skill-floor, dynamic champion. Tank Ekko is definitely more powerful, with little to no gameplay interaction, and is like Nidalee/Leblanc/Fizz/Zed levels of infuriating cancer.
